item.title: Pokemon Fan Shares Mega Krookodile Concept
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Mega Evolutions are making a comeback in Pokemon Legends: Z-A, sparking excitement among fans.
  • Fan-created Mega Krookodile design draws inspiration from Spinosaurus for a primal appearance.
  • Fans are eager for potential Spinosaur-influenced Pokemon in upcoming games, keeping excitement high.

A Pokemon fan has shared a concept for what a Mega Krookodile could look like. The impressive art seems to combine the Pokemon with a particular type of dinosaur, and Pokemon fans are quite enthusiastic about it.

Pokemon Mega Evolutions are getting a comeback in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , putting the unique form back in the forefront of many players' minds. As fans continue to wait for news about the next Pokemon game, those who are artistically inclined are already hard at work dreaming up Mega Evolutions that could fit into the future title.

Pokemon fan lefrancocolombien shared a unique Mega Evolution for Krookodile that their wife created. The evolutionary form puts Krookodile on four legs, rather than standing up on two like its normal form. The Pokemon looks much stronger and more frightening, with more pronounced claws, teeth, and a fiercer face. The Pokemon also has quite pronounced back spikes. All of these features give the Pokemon a more primal appearance, which is what lefrancocolombien's wife wants to see more of in the series.

Mega Krookodile Design Inspiration and Details

While the artist or their spouse didn't specifically state that the Pokemon is partially based off of a Spinosaurus, numerous fans have made comparisons between the two. The Spinosaurus was a dinosaur with distinct back neural spines that's believed to have lived about 100 million years ago. The design does seem to take inspiration from it, though Mega Krookodile's back spines are more spiky, and its front legs are larger.

Fans were curious about the specifications of the Mega Krookodile, and lefrancocolombien shared their concepts. The Mega Krookodile would have Strong Jaw as its ability, Fissure Fang as its Signature Move, and would be a high-crit ratio Prehistoric Crocodile Pokemon. The design intends for Mega Krookodoile to be fast and hard-hitting, with suggested stats of HP: 95 (+0), Attack: 142 (+25), Defense: 100 (+20), Special Atack: 70 (+5), Special Defense: 80 (+5) and Speed: 137 (+45).

Pokemon fans have shared their admiration for the Mega Krookodile design, with several stating that the games need an official Spinosaur-influenced Pokemon. It remains to be seen if Pokemon Legends: Z-A will introduce Mega Evolution Pokemon influenced by dinosaurs, but fans are excited to see what's revealed either way. While the developers have remain tight-lipped about the game thus far, fan designs like these are helping to keep expectant players involved and interested in the potential of the upcoming game.

item.title: Kingdom Hearts II: All Keyblades & How to Get Them
item.description:
Throughout Kingdom Hearts II , players will visit a variety of worlds, many of which are filled with familiar landscapes, as well as both friendly and villainous characters from iconic Disney franchises. In these worlds, players will often team up with heroes from these universes to complete missions, unlock clues to progress forward and go head-to-head against antagonists of the heroes you assist along the way.

During these adventures, you will have the chance to obtain different Keyblades, each of which offers a unique balance of stats that you can use to increase the effectiveness of your playstyle or gain an advantage against a specific enemy. Many of these Keyblades are linked to one of the worlds that you explore and can be obtained by progressing the story or meeting the criteria of certain side quests and missions. If you're wondering which Keyblades are available in Kingdom Hearts II and how to get them, then you can find all of the information you'll need in the guide below.

All Keyblades in Kingdom Hearts II & How to Get Them

Here is a helpful table that can help you get every Keyblade:

Keyblade Name

How to Obtain

Keyblade Description

Kingdom Key

  • Complete battle against the Mysterious Enemy at Old Mansion

  • A keychain attached to the Keyblade. Increases defense at critical moments.

Kingdom Key D

  • Temporary - in certain boss battles only

  • Choose "I won't give up!" when knocked out

Way to the Dawn

  • Riku's default weapon

  • Deals various attacks.

Destiny's Embrace

  • Wielded by Kiara exclusively

  • N/A

Star Seeker

  • Talk with Flora, Fauna, and Merryweather in Mysterious Tower.

  • Increases maximum combo by 1 when in midair.

Stormfall

  • Seen beside Aqua's armor in the Chamber of Repose - but not obtainable.

  • N/A

Ends of the Earth

  • wielded by the Lingering Will exclusively

  • White Trinity Mark in Wonderland's Lotus Forest

Rumbling Rose

  • Has great strength, allowing finishing combo moves to be unleashed successively.

  • Reunite with Beast in Beast's Castle.

Hidden Dragon

  • Restores MP relative to the amount of damage taken.

  • Defeat Shan-Yu in The Land of Dragons.

Hero's Crest

  • Increases the damage of the finishing move in the air relative to the number of hits in the combo.

  • Defeat the Hydra in Olympus Coliseum.

Mysterious Abyss

  • Enhances magic to increase damage dealt by blizzard-based attacks.

  • Complete Ursula's Revenge in Atlantica.

Monochrome

  • Increases the effect of restoration items used on the field.

  • Complete Timeless River.

Wishing Lamp

  • Wishes come true by increasing the drop rate of munny, HP, and MP orbs.

  • Defeat Jafar in Agrabah.

Follow the Wind

  • Draws in nearby orbs.

  • Defeat Captain Barbossa in Port Royal.

Circle of Life

  • Has great strength, increasing MP restoration speed after MP is consumed.

  • Talk to Simba in the Oasis of Pride Lands.

Decisive Pumpkin

  • The greater number of combos landed, the more damage is dealt, leading to a strong finishing move!

  • Defeat The Experiment in Halloween Town.

Photon Debugger

  • Increases damage done by thunder-based attacks.

  • Defeat the Hostile Program in the Space Paranoids.

Sweet Memories

  • Although it does not enhance attack strength, it increases the drop rate of items.

  • Complete The Expotition mini-game in the Hundred Acre Wood.

Gull Wing

  • Greatly increases the amount of experience gained when defeating an enemy at a critical moment.

  • Complete the Battle of the 1000 Heartless in Hollow Bastion, and speak with the Gullwings.

Sleeping Lion

  • Well-balanced with strength and magic, increasing maximum ground-based combos by 1.

  • Talk to Leon before the second visit to Space Paranoids.

Guardian Soul

  • Has great strength, increasing the amount of damage dealt from Reaction Commands.

  • Defeat Hades in the Underworld of Olympus Coliseum.

Fenrir

  • Has great range and strength, but maximum ground and midair combos are decreased by 1.

  • Talk to Cloud after defeating Sephiroth at Radiant Garden, then return to the Dark Depths and talk to Sephiroth.

Two Become One

  • A weapon of great strength and magic that has a special effect.

  • Defeat Roxas in front of Memory's Skyscraper. (Final Mix only)

Bond of Flame

  • Enhances magic to increase damage dealt by fire-based attacks.

  • Defeat the Nobodies in Betwixt and Between.

Fatal Crest

  • Increases strength during MP Charge and allows unlimited chaining of combos. When equipped, the combo finishing move is disabled.

  • Complete the Goddess of Fate Cup.

Winner's Proof

  • Has high strength and holds an excellent magic power. When the enemies are defeated, experience points are not gained.

  • Complete all of the Mushroom XIII minigames. (Final Mix only)

item.title: One World of Warcraft Fan Might Have Found The War Within's Next Zone
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Players discovered a mysterious barrier in WoW's Azj-Kahet zone that teleports them away if they try to fly past a certain point.
  • The barrier may hint at a new zone called "The Rootlands," connected to the Emerald Dream and the Haranir.
  • Patch 11.0.5 is expected to arrive around WoW's 20th anniversary in November, with potential clues leading to the new zone.

A World of Warcraft fan recently discovered a location in The War Within zone of Azj-Kahet that forcibly teleports players away if they try to fly past a certain point. This curious barrier could be a relic from development, but it could also be a teaser for a new zone in the World of Warcraft expansion.

Azj-Kahet is the fourth zone in World of Warcraft: The War Within . The vast majority of the region is dominated by a Nerubian kingdom, but the parts bordering Hallowfall contain a massive network of roots where the Haranir dwell.

While exploring this region of the new zone, World of Warcraft fan and dataminer Marlamin flew directly upwards, past a Skyriding glyph in WoW: The War Within 's Azj-Kahet zone and into the roots above. However, upon doing so, they were afflicted by the Drowsy debuff, which then filled the screen with green, teleporting them back to the ground near the Ruptured Lake. This impassable barrier is similar to the one used in places like the Dreamgrove in Legion , suggesting it, and the nearby roots, could have a connection to the Emerald Dream.

‘The Rootlands’ – Future Zone in WoW: The War Within?

A leaked map of Khaz Algar suggested a zone called “The Rootlands” was originally planned for The War Within . The Haranir who guard the roots likely originate from this mysterious zone, which is almost certainly connected to Elune’Ahir – a great World Tree destroyed by the Titan Aman’thul and connected to the Emerald Dream, teased during Dragonflight . Given the evidence, and the fact that the Haranir were given a spotlight in the cinematic trailer for WoW: The War Within despite their small role in the main story so far, a zone about these storied roots would fit perfectly in the story – and this off-limits barrier may be where players eventually enter it.

On the other hand, this in-game barrier could just as easily be a relic from early development. Fans have also discovered evidence of raids inspired by Goblins and Ethereals, which would not exactly fit in The Rootlands. World of Warcraft: Dragonflight Patch 10.2 also took players to the Emerald Dream, so another nature-themed zone so soon after would need something to differentiate it. That said, it would also be the perfect time to add the Haranir as an Allied Race in WoW , given the huge number of customization options they have.

Either way, fans won’t have to wait too long to find out. Patch 11.0.5 is expected to arrive around WoW ’s 20th anniversary in November, meaning 11.0.7 will likely arrive early next year. 11.1 – and The War Within ’s first post-launch zone – will probably drop in spring 2025, so players will have to keep an eye out for more clues between now and then.

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals 2 Rare Skins Could Be Returning to the Shop After More Than 3 Years
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Rare skins Bravo Leader and Trench Raider could be returning to the Fortnite shop on August 27 and 30 after more than 3 years.
  • The leak reveals the upcoming return of many skins and cosmetic items.

A recent Fortnite leak may have just confirmed the return of two extremely rare skins, Bravo Leader and Trench Raider, that players have not had the chance to add to their collections for over three years. The leak claimed to confirm the return of a variety of new items coming to the Fortnite shop in the coming months; Bravo Leader and Trench Raider have been away the longest and are set to return on August 27 and 30.

Items in the Fortnite shop do not provide any in-game advantages, but given how rare some of them can be, they often become huge commodities within the community, with many players waiting eagerly for old items to return. Many of them, however, go a long time without ever showing up, such as the Reflex skin that has been absent from Fortnite for over 2,000 days and counting.

According to known Twitter leaker HYPEX, avid collectors of in-game cosmetics will get another shot at grabbing a couple of the rarer skins as early as tonight, August 27, when the item shop updates and the Bravo Leader skin appears. Those looking to purchase the Trench Raider set will have to wait until the Fortnite item shop goes through its usual cycle on Friday evening, as it will be available starting on August 30.

Fortnite Leak Allegedly Confirms Return of Rare Skins

  • Bravo Leader - August 27
  • Trench Raider - August 30

Several rare skins have been making their return to the item shop in recent months, with sets like the highly sought-after Mogul Masters cosmetics showing up in Fortnite for the first time in a while. There are still plenty of other skins that have yet to make comebacks, but with developer Epic Games' recent focus on returning content from previous seasons, it may only be a matter of time before fans see them once more.

Luckily, however, the leak also seemingly confirmed the upcoming return of a variety of rare and highly desirable skins and other cosmetic items, many of which are part of major collaborations from previous seasons. Specifically, the player skins from the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles collaboration event are allegedly set to return on August 29, including related cosmetic items alongside them.

In any case, players have plenty of options coming up for new skins to deck themselves out with as they go against the various Marvel comic icons that currently reside on the Fortnite island. Spider-Man recently returned to Fortnite with a brand-new Iron Spider skin while Mysterio, one of his greatest enemies, appears in the battle pass alongside Gwenpool, Dr. Doom, and War Machine.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14 Targeted By More DDoS Attacks
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • DDoS attacks continue to plague Final Fantasy 14, disrupting gameplay experiences for fans since early summer.
  • Attacks hit multiple servers, causing login difficulties, lag, and disconnects, impacting player progress and teamwork.
  • Square Enix is working to minimize attack impact, but players should stay informed through official updates for any future disruptions.

Final Fantasy 14 has been struck by DDoS attacks yet again, disrupting players' experiences. This has been an unfortunately repeating event for Final Fantasy 14 fans since early summer.

Final Fantasy 14 recently saw the release of its latest major expansion, Dawntrail. While fans have been enjoying exploring everything the new expansion has to offer, it hasn't been without troubles. In addition to Final Fantasy 14 instituting some early graphical fixes for issues that cropped up after the game's visual upgrade, players have also had some troubles over the last few months as the game is peppered by DDoS attacks.

Over the weekend, Final Fantasy 14 experienced DDos attacks yet again. Starting on Friday, the Europe, North America, and Oceania servers were hit by DDoS attacks that lasted for about two hours. During this time, players experienced difficulties logging in and may have experienced lag or disconnects once they got into the game. After a brief reprieve, more attacks transpired on August 25, which this time targeted all data centers. Square Enix says the second attack only lasted half an hour, perhaps indicating that the company is finding better ways to cut down on the impact of the attacks.

How DDoS Attacks Impact the Final Fantasy 14 Playerbase

In an online game like Final Fantasy 14 , DDoS attacks can be a serious problem. All online games have problems they can potentially face from simple DDoS attacks, which can potentially interrupt and change the flow of a game. However, Final Fantasy 14 has its own problems with DDoS attacks, especially with longer-form content. Lag can make the difference between life or death for player characters when it prevents healers and tanks from acting. However, it's also a massive headache for longer-form content, like raids or deep dungeons. Whether a player is completely disconnected or simply can't act for a moment, it could mean losing plenty of progress and letting down a team.

Sadly, DDoS attacks have become a fact of life for plenty of online games. While private user data is generally not in any danger, DDoS attacks can ruin a player's day, especially when they're targeting the weekend when more players login. The motives behind the DDoS attacks aren't known, though it may just be a matter of trying to ruin players' fun. For the moment, the servers are back to normal, but players should keep an eye on the game's official Lodestone updates if they notice lag issues, as it could be happening yet again.
